de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator

Class AbstractDecorator<DialogType extends Dialog,ParamType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.AbstractDecorator<DialogType,ParamType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dialog, DialogDecorator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDialogDecorator, AbstractDialogFragmentDecorator

    public abstract class AbstractDecorator<DialogType extends Dialog,ParamType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DialogDecorator
    An abstract base class for all decorators, which allow to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog.
    Since:
    4.2.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        Dialog.Gravity

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        MATCH_PARENT, WRAP_CONTENT

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDecorator

        public AbstractDecorator(@NonNull
                         DialogType dialog)
        Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog, whose view hierarchy should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the generic type DialogType. The dialog may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • onAttach

        @NonNull
protected abstract java.util.Map<DialogRootView.ViewType,android.view.View> onAttach(@NonNull
                                                                                              android.view.Window window,
                                                                                              @NonNull
                                                                                              android.view.View view,
                                                                                              @NonNull
                                                                                              java.util.Map<DialogRootView.ViewType,android.view.View> areas,
                                                                                              ParamType param)
        The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is attached to the view hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        window - The window of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class Window. The window may not be null
        view - The root view of the dialog, which is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        areas - A map, which contains the areas, which have already been added by previously attached decorators, as well as the corresponding views, as an instance of the type Map or an empty map, if no areas have been added
        param - The parameter, which should be passed to the decorator, as an instance of the generic type ParamType or null, if no parameter should be passed
        Returns:
        A map, which contains the views, which have been inflated by the decorator, mapped to their view types, as an instance of the type Map or null, if the decorator has not inflated any views

      • onDetach

        protected abstract void onDetach()
        The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is detached from the view hierarchy.

      • attach

        @NonNull
public final java.util.Map<DialogRootView.ViewType,android.view.View> attach(@NonNull
                                                                                      android.view.Window window,
                                                                                      @NonNull
                                                                                      android.view.View view,
                                                                                      @NonNull
                                                                                      java.util.Map<DialogRootView.ViewType,android.view.View> areas,
                                                                                      ParamType param)
        Attaches the decorator to the view hierarchy. This enables the decorator to modify the view hierarchy until it is detached.
        Parameters:
        window - The window of the dialog, whose view hierarchy should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class Window. The window may not be null
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        areas - A map, which contains the areas, which have already been added by previously attached decorators, as well as the corresponding views, as an instance of the type Map or an empty map, if no areas have been added
        param - The parameter, which should be passed to the decorator, as an instance of the generic type ParamType or null, if no parameter should be passed
        Returns:
        A map, which contains the views, which have been inflated by the decorator, mapped to their view types, as an instance of the type Map or null, if the decorator has not inflated any views

      • detach

        public final void detach()
        Detaches the decorator from the view hierarchy. This prevents the decorator from modifying the view hierarchy until it is attached again.

      • addAreaListener

        public final void addAreaListener(@NonNull
                                  AreaListener listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when an area is modified by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type AreaListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeAreaListener

        public final void removeAreaListener(@NonNull
                                     AreaListener listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when an area is modified by the decorator, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type AreaListener. The listener may not be null

      • notifyOnAreaShown

        protected final void notifyOnAreaShown(@NonNull
                                       ScrollableArea.Area area)
        Notifies the listeners, which have been registered to be notified, when the visibility of the dialog's areas has been changed, about an area being shown.
        Parameters:
        area - The area, which has been shown, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area. The area may not be null

      • notifyOnAreaHidden

        protected final void notifyOnAreaHidden(@NonNull
                                        ScrollableArea.Area area)
        Notifies the listeners, which have been registered to be notified, when the visibility of the dialog's areas has been changed, about an area being hidden.
        Parameters:
        area - The area, which has been hidden, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area. The area may not be null

      • getDialog

        @NonNull
protected final DialogType getDialog()
        Returns the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator.
        Returns:
        The dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the generic type DialogType. The dialog may not be null

      • getWindow

        @Nullable
protected final android.view.Window getWindow()
        Returns the window of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator.
        Returns:
        The window of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class Window or null, if the decorator is not attached

      • getView

        @Nullable
protected final android.view.View getView()
        Returns the root view of the view hierarchy, which is modified by the decorator.
        Returns:
        The root view of the view hierarchy, which is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View or null, if the decorator is not attached

      • getRootView

        @Nullable
protected final DialogRootView getRootView()
        Returns the root view of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator.
        Returns:
        The root view of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class DialogRootView or null, if the decorator is not attached
